intro: Gyptis crassipes, commonly known as the broad-leaved gyptis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features robust, succulent stems and large, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in arid environments. Its yellow-orange flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Gyptis crassipes is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and limited rainfall.
